Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Sweet-Dot’ offers an extraordinarily sweet, almost candied flavor with distinct hazelnut undertones and a remarkably tender, delicate texture. The adductor muscle is small but perfectly formed, cooking to an opaque white with a buttery softness. The meat has a higher natural sugar content than most bivalves, creating a caramelized exterior when seared. Live specimens display vibrant blue eyespots along the mantle edge and active swimming behavior.

2. The Delicate Sweet Specialty This scallop’s intense sweetness and petite size make it ideal for applications where subtlety and rapid cooking are essential.

  • Quick Sear or Ceviche: The premier preparation - seared for mere seconds to caramelize the natural sugars or “cooked” in citrus juice for ceviche, preserving their delicate texture.
  • Raw Crudo or Sashimi: Served raw with minimal accompaniments like high-quality olive oil and sea salt to highlight their natural sweetness.
  • Scallop Butter Sauté: Quickly sautéed in brown butter with fresh herbs, where their small size ensures even cooking and perfect texture.
  • Gourmet Garnish: Used whole as an elegant garnish for seafood dishes, adding both visual appeal and bursts of sweet flavor.

3. The Harvest & Growth Cycle ‘Sweet-Dot’ is a rapid-growing, active filter feeder that thrives in well-oxygenated water with moderate flow. Their swimming ability helps them maintain optimal positioning for feeding. In a Haloponic™ system with suspended trays, a square meter of growing space can yield 2-3 kg of premium micro scallops over a 10-12 week cycle, reaching harvest size of 3 cm in 9-10 weeks from spat.
